entries.content: Session start: Investigating {{NOTIFICATIONS_CSS_URI}} placeholder replacement issue. Notification system fully built but CSS not loading due to template placeholder not being replaced by ResourcePipeline.

Found the issue! TemplateInjector.ts buildTokenMap() method is missing the {{NOTIFICATIONS_CSS_URI}} token mapping on line 69. CssUriResolver has the notifications property (line 43) but TemplateInjector doesn't map it to the placeholder token.

Fixed the CSS loading issue by adding '{{NOTIFICATIONS_CSS_URI}}': cssUris.notifications.toString() to TemplateInjector.ts line 70. The complete chain now works: ResourceManager config → CssUriResolver resolution → TemplateInjector token mapping → base.html placeholder replacement.
User feedback: Notifications are too large for the small chat UI. Need to make them much smaller.

Made notifications much smaller for small chat UI:
- Container: max-width 420px → 280px, padding 16px → 10px, gap 12px → 8px
- Card: padding 16px → 8px 10px, border-radius 12px → 8px, gap 12px → 8px
- Icon: 20px → 14px
- Message: font-size 14px → 12px, line-height 1.5 → 1.4
- Close button: 24px → 18px, SVG 14px → 10px
- Progress bar: height 3px → 2px, border-radius 12px → 8px
User wants design changes to notifications: keep the timer/progress bar, make design more flat (less glassmorphic), darker background, and add opacity (more transparent).
User also wants notifications positioned at bottom-right instead of top-right. Need to change default position in NotificationController.

Transformed notification design: flat, dark, transparent + bottom-right position. CSS changes: background rgba(15,15,18,0.75), removed backdrop-filter blur, simplified shadow, 6px border-radius, opacity hover. Default position changed from 'top-right' to 'bottom-right' in NotificationFactory.js:20.
Session complete! Successfully fixed CSS loading issue and redesigned notifications to be flat, dark, transparent, smaller, and positioned at bottom-right. User is happy with the result.
